Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Madadzal
Reviews.Content: Ir was very good although we were sent from another htl to here to our surprise it was vey clean and stylish the only thE only thing that we were in a basement room115 the right infront of the parking lot with the three trash can and the truck came to pick it up at 8. The wifi coverage is not very good also it very hard to get through and once you are in it it just cuts off But the Service was excellent nice breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Confortable in a great location”
Reviews.Author: erreci61
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was a pleasant surprise. I've booked it by chance in a overbooked spring weekend (the weekend before Easter). The hotel is strategically located, 5 minutes walking from Piazza del Popolo and from there you are in the Central Rome pedestrian area relly close to all the beauties...Piazza di Spagna, Via Condotti, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Fontana di Trevi... The Vatican with the Museums is about half an hour walking in the other way but If you doo't like walking the metro is just two blocks away... Strategically and central located but in a really quite residential area, clean and without the noisy tipical roman traffic. The room and the bathroom were perfectly sized and clean - not huge but definitely not small. The breakfast was also ok. Finally the price I think was just right.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Place in a Quiet Part of Town”
Reviews.Author: coopcoldspot
Reviews.Content: Although the room was small it was very quiet and well equipped with adequate reading lights ( how many times does that happen in a hotel?). Very clean and the breakfasts were excellent. It was a 25 minute walk to the Vatican, a 5 minute walk to the subway or bus 280 which took you to Trastevere/or Ghetto. I loved being away from the bustle of the historic district. We tended to walk everywhere including the Borghese Gallery (30 minutes). Highly recommended. Coop

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: maggiecking
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a really great location, 2 minutes from the metro, although we didnt need to use it much, 10 minutes walk from the Vatican, 10 minutes from Spanish steps and really in walking distance of any of the main attractions so very convenient if you want to come and go between sightseeing trips and have a siesta. The area that the hotels in is full of bars and restaurants, (just walk down the main street towards the Vatican, lots of shops along it), a very Italian area so you don,t get ripped off all the time, like you do around the tourist spots-avoid eating anywhere near the Spanish steps, we paid double for a very basic meal on the first night here. Trastevere is a great area for bars, restaurants and lovely to walk around at night-it,s about a 40 minute walk down the river from the hotel. The hotel barman, Emanuel is a real character and makes fantastic cocktails. The rooms are pretty basic, we stayed in the annex which was quiet, the cleaners are great and we came back every day to a spotless room with clean towels. Shame about the drain smell from the bathroom but I think that.s a common thing in Rome, just leave the window open if you have one. Beds are very comfortable, I slept better than I have for years but maybe it was because we were averaging 15Ks of walking a day! All in all I would love to come back to Rome and to this hotel. All the staff are helpful, they even looked for an umbrella for us when it rained one evening.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in city center”
Reviews.Author: moslawyer
Reviews.Content: WE have stayed at this hotel at the beginning of march 2012.Very stylish 4 star hotel not far from Vatican and Piazza del Poppolo.Nice location on a quite street.Lobby and the bar with a fireplace.Classical and elegant room decoration.All the rooms with a high ceilings.Superior rooms have an antique furniture.Very nice buffet breakfast which included to the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for long weekend”
Reviews.Author: no1steveb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 01-04 March 2012 and had a thoroughly enjoyable time. Once we got our bearings we established it was well situated. Vatican City is about a 25 minute walk. (We are not fast walkers) The metro system is fantastic. The nearest Metro is Lepanto which is about 10 minutes..at 1euro for 75 mins you cant go wrong. Being so close to Lepanto meant we could go to the tourist sites. Having walked to the Vatican on day 1, we got the metro back from Ottaviano which just saved our legs as there is so much to see. Day 2 we again took the Metro down to the Colloseum (using both A & B metro routes - very easy) and all the sights local to that area. Later back on the Metro to Spagna for the Spannish steps which didnt really need long, so we rejoined the Metro with the same ticket back to Lepanto. Day 3, Metro to Barberine, for the walk through to the Trevi fountain, the Pantheon, Piazza Navora over the Ponte Umberto and home to the Hotel, in time to get the mid afternoon taxi back to the Airport. With all this sightseeing the Hotel was a welcome retreat. Afternoon pot of tea in their garden and then a few cocktails in the bar before venturing out to dinner in the evening, was all very pleasant to say the least. We had a superior room which was sizeable and had bathrobes & slippers provided. I'd ordered a bottle of prozzecco to be there on arrival , which also hit the spot and pleased the "other half". Breakfasts were adequate, although the hot buffet had seen better days by the time we emerged at about 0900hrs each day. But plenty of everything else. Staff were all very friendly. Cannot fault the hotel and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: Notdunroaming
Reviews.Content: Eight of us stayed over (4 couples) for a Valentine weekend, oh and we watched Italy v England at rugby too! The weather was cold with loads of snow but we had a warm reception in this hotel. staff were very friendly, the buffet style breakfast was very varied and plentiful. Seemed to have more Italians staying than tourists too. Rooms very very impressive in terms of decor although not big, nice and warm compared with outside. Great little bar for the late night aperitif and a brilliant location. Would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect end to a perfect honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: feb77
Reviews.Content: We spent the final five days of our honeymoon at the Hotel Giulio Cesare and we could not have wished for a better finish to an amazing trip. After a fairly hectic few weeks travelling through Italy, it was a pleasant change of pace to say here. It is extremely well situated in a very quiet residential street but only a five minute walk from the metro station. The other benefit of staying a little further out of the city centre is that the hotel is extremely spacious. We had a suite on the first floor, which also had the balcony immediately above the entrance. The room was very comfortable. The fixtures, fittings and décor were verging on being a little tired but given then ambience of the hotel (it is very classic and elegant rather than modern) it was absolutely fine. It is only a 20 minute walk to the Vatican in one direction and 20 minutes in the other direction takes you to Borghese park. There are a few great restaurants in the area, full of locals which I think is always a good sign. There is also the best Gelateria in Rome (trust us, we tried a few!) on Via Marcantonio Colonna just around the corner. Breakfast was always lovely and there was a good selection each day. We were a little disappointed that it wasn’t ever served outside in the courtyard (which is lovely) as was suggested on the hotel website but this is about the only thing we could complain about in our whole stay. The reception staff were very efficient. Not the cheeriest people in the world, but were always very helpful so no complaints on that front either. If a little oasis away from the throngs of tourists is what you are after then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “tranquility in Rome !”
Reviews.Author: Ericsweden_11
Reviews.Content: Beginning with an early Christmas holiday with the family, Hotel Giulio Cesare met all expectation that most European and American travelers would appreciate. Style, comfort and each staff member was unique and helpful. The breakfast will satisfy all tastes. The location is 10 min. to the Vatican and next to the Tiber river. Check out the views from the roof deck, for some amazing city photos. The quaint bar downstairs at night with a real fire is the perfect ending to a long day of walking in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoT3
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giulio Cesare is located a short walk from Piazza del Popolo on the other side of the Tiber River in an upscale, quiet neighborhood known as the Prati section of ancient Rome. It is walking distance to all major attractions, the metro is a block away, and we love the added benefit of feeling we are part of a neighborhood during our stay. Close by is the via Cola di Rienzo, which is a lovely shopping avenue filled with wonderful shops and cafes. If you want the "real" Roman experience, try this hotel. Rooms are well cared for and comfortable, and the breakfast is wonderful. I wouldn't stay in any other hotel while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms and service, great little bar”
Reviews.Author: dennis h
Reviews.Content: A fantastic standard room, with space, views, a bed, a bathroom and in particularly a jacuzzi bath that all were far from "standard". The hotel staff were great; genuinely proud of their hotel and warmly friendly without a hint of pretence. Everything sparkling clean. The breakfast, delivered to the room at short notice, was delicious.Amazing weekend.Yes thank you for your advice Porto di Ripetta Restaurant was very wonderful, We'll be back. Probably quite a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Giulio Cesare a Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: teddy r
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised by the property, it is very well kept, has a lot of history and was a great place to get peaceful and restful sleep after a very busy day. The staff was wonderful and the breakfast was very good. Everyone That Worked in the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Were there a lot of amenities Within walking distance. We would definitely return to this hotel if the opportunity ever comes around again.A big thank you for booking the Porto di Ripetta

Reviews.Title: “Very good.”
Reviews.Author: rajesh_mdrd
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel wih good sized rooms. Excellent breakfast. Very quiet for a good night's sleep. Slighly firm mattress which all of us particularly liked. I do not prefer mattresses that are too soft. Free and fast Wifi. Less than 5 min walk to Lepanto Metro station. Tiber river bank is 2 min away. 15 min walk to Vatican and Piazza del Popolo. Only one moan - I didn't find any coffee or tea making facilities in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: ron l
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days earlier this month. The view is fantastic! The room was very nice and quiet. Very convenient for getting around Roma. Parking is a bit expensive but it's the city so parking is going to be expensive. The bed was very comfortable. If you had more than 2 people in the room it would probably stay very well too. There was some construction going on but it wasn't too noisy. There are a few places to get breakfast or lunch right nearby . Staff was very helpful when I had a question or needed help with something. Wifi is free in the lobby and in the rooms. If I was back in Rome I would definitely stay here again.Thank you the Porto de ripetta restaurant was fabolous.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gustav F
Reviews.Content: Splendid boutique hotel, extremely well located: a 12-minute walk to the Vatican and to Piazza del Popolo, and just two blocks from the Lepanto Metro Station for easy access to all of Rome. The staff is very courteous, professional and knowledgeable, and makes you feel like an honored guest and not like just another tourist. The hotel’s breakfast is incredibly good; all that plus extremely comfortable rooms, a library, and free WiFi internet access, and it’s easy to see why guests fall in love with the Hotel Giulio Cesare. This gem of a hotel is for the discerning traveler, not for backpackers looking for a cheap stay. It offers outstanding value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anne952
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Giulio Cesare for 6 nights earlier this month. We had a lovely spacious room with lots of storage space and a lovely bathroom. The bed linen and towels were changed every day. The choice at breakfast was huge with both hot and cold dishes and the breakfast room was run very competently by Ciro. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. There was a courtyard garden which we sat in the first 2 nights when we came back after dinner and had a drink, but it was a bit cold to do this being November. It would be a lovely place to sit in warmer weather. The hotel also has a well-stocked bar with pleasant bar staff. There were amazing views from the hotel's roof. It is very well situated for all the sights of Rome and we walked everywhere from it. There was a Metro station nearby if you got tired! Also, the price was very good for that standard of accommodation. I would not hesitate to stay there if I returned to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: w r
Reviews.Content: Good hospitality Great location Great breakfast And a very interesting encounter with owners of hotel Mr and Ms Pandolfo In short, memorable stay

Reviews.Title: “fairly good hotel, perfect for a stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Jake P
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel and really great staff that were always there to help and spoke perfect english! fabulous breakfast with loads of choice between hot and cold food. Really good location, nice walk to Vatican although its not a very quick one, took about 15 minutes to get to the vatican walls. Not too far down the road from the Vatican there is a great night life with a market and live bands etc, well worth a visit!!! Metro stop right round the corner which can connect you to pretty much anywhere in the city. The bar was quite expensive and fairly dead so we never had a drink there but if you can afford it its nice and there is a nice outside terrace to have a drink on. The room wasn't very big but had everything we could have needed for a short stay, comfy bed, TV etc. Really expensive mini bar!!! but overall we would deffinitely recommend it to anyone and would love to go and stay again, much better than we were expecting for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay there.”
Reviews.Author: mrdupey
Reviews.Content: This is an Old World type hotel. Located in a residential area. Walking distance to downtown shopping. Very close to Vatican. Our room had a huge updated bathroom. Probably the most charming was a patio in the rear of the hotel. Plenty of tables, chairs and plants. Very good free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I love you rome and this hotel”
Reviews.Author: gustaw p
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel, the friendliness, cleanliness, price is not expensive, large rooms make this hotel one of the best where we've been up to now, the area is in central london, excellent breakfast and room service, also good was the advice we have received to try the restaurant Porto di Ripetta

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel & Staff and the Breakfast is Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: goodwillme
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on our 3 week honeymoon and we were very impressed with the hotel during our 4 night stay. Friendly staff who spoke excellent English, well appointed beautiful rooms that were beautifully decorated and super clean with plenty of room (we had a 'Superior' Room). The breakfast in the morning was *amazing* and the best by far that we had during our stay in Italy. The breakfast staff were impeccable and kept the bountiful buffet (eggs, meats, cheeses, grilled veggies, fruit, pastries, on and on and on...) well stocked and the cappuccino flowing! In the evening we very much enjoyed chatting with the very warm and kind bartender, Franco, (hello from Boston Franco!) after a long day of sightseeing--the outdoor garden was a particularly lovely place to enjoy a cocktail and a bite to eat. We found all of the staff to be courteous and friendly and the hotel is about a 15 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, the Vatican, and many museums--or short rides on the subway which is even closer. We flew in to FCO airport and the hotel arranged for a private car to pick us up--this was an additional fee (~50 euros) paid directly to the driver but we found it well worth it arriving so early after the long flight from JFK. The hotel was recommended by an Italian native for it's location, amenities, and good pricing and it did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel, location not that good”
Reviews.Author: hyndera
Reviews.Content: It is a small hotel, it feels like entering an old italian villa, lovely decoration, but rather too much (carpets everywhere and heavy curtains). The rooms are quite dark, and we didn't have a balkony (I am not sure if any balkonies are available in the hotel rooms). It was ok because we stayed in December, but I don't think I would like to stay in this hotel in the summer, I would feel suffocated!! Nevertheless, the hotel has a beautiful little garden, which must be a delight in the summer. The personnel was extremely helpful, polite and very discreet. The breakfast was also very nice, with local delights. The most significant drawback of the hotel is that it is rather far off the old part of the city where most of the sightseeings are, so you need to walk for about 15 to 20 minutes before getting to all the interesting parts of town . We had to take a cab everywhere (not very expensive, but we missed the joy of walking around). There is a metro station quite nearby, but unfortunately the old part of Rome is not accessible via metro. You can go to other parts of the city, though! Overall a nice hotel, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: JACKIE M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautifully decorated with a great hidden patio for relaxing after the day. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. The location was perfect for us, not right in town so you could get out of the crowds when you wanted but it had a Metro station 2 blocks away, The Vatican about a 15 minute walk in one direction and the Piazza del Popolo was about 5 minutes in the other direction with the Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain another 10 minute walk. Breakfast was wonderful with many choices of hot and cold items or pastries. Nice selection of light sandwiches or gelati treats very moderately priced to eat on the patio with your drink from the bar. Very quiet street, inexpensive shopping if you head away from the city centre and lots of restaurants close. We loved it and hope to be back soon, we will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: jeespox
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in good location and it's easy to find. We had a room with a lovely private terrace, which was about the same size as our room. The room wasn't really big, but there was enough room to move around. Bathroom had some minor problems, paint was coming off at some points, but it was clean and stylish anyways. My girlfriend dared to take a bath in the bathtub so that means good standard with the cleanliness. The breakfast was surprisingly good for an Italian hotel, there was three differently made eggs for example. Overall, everything worked well, service was really polite and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip all the more enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Ayesha K
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a prime location, less than 10 minutes away from the Lepanto metro station and just a 15 minute walk to Piazza del Poppolo. It's in a beautiful, leafy neighborhood. our room was very tastefully furnished and a great place to come home to after a full days sightseeing. The breakfast buffet had a delicious selection of fresh produce from the owner's own farm. The staff were very courteous and helpful. Especially the people staffing the lobby, who tirelessly answered our sightseeing queries. The hotel helped make our Roman Holiday all the more enjoyable, and we recommend it to everyone. But the best part was that the owner was very much into the running of the hotel and that gave an undeniable authenticity to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: awalknx67
Reviews.Content: the best hotels in rome, luxury all too kind, especially the concierge Mr. Robert who has recommended a wonderful restaurant on Ripetta, I want to thank all of them, this will be my hotel in rome

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star caliber hotel!! In dire need of renovation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mikenmar22000
Reviews.Content: Got sent here after being bounced from another hotel that had overbooked. Majorly disappointed. The room looked like it might have been nice back around 1990. The wallpaper was peeling off the wall in multiple spots. There was a large tile pulling loose from the outside of the tub where it looked like the tile hadn't been cleaned for some time. The tile in the tub had been broken, caulked back together, and was growing black mold. The carpeting was faded and stained. The room had a faint odor to it. The finish was chipping off the furniture. Thee was some kind of drop-down panel for the ceiling that wasn't fully in place and had chipping all around it with respect to the paint. The pay wifi was slow at best. Overall a very disappointing way to spend our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & staff. Rooms & bathrooms were sizeable & modern”
Reviews.Author: TotusTuusFamily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, our 2 teens and 2 younger children took two "sleeps 3" rooms. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of the rooms and the modern bathrooms with excellent water pressure. We had read that European hotels might feel cramped to Americans. Not this one! The hotel was elegant. The staff went out of their way for us and were very friendly. We were very close to the Piazza del Populo and transportation and the front desk made excellent recommendations. The children didn't mind getting up in the morning as they looked forward to the breakfast which had a huge variety of delicious foods. The rooms were kept very clean, and we all slept well on the beds. The one negative was that in May air conditioning is "non permisso". At night, it would have really helped to keep the windows closed as the street noise was noticeable. A symphony of cats, seagulls, and car alarms could have even been muted with a ceiling fan. But you know what? We still all slept well, tired from full days of excitement in Rome. We are in LOVE with Rome and hope to come back and stay again at the Giulio Cesare! Make sure to have nightcaps in the garden! I recommend the Limoncello.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: RamoGirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at the tail end of a nine week trip that had included a tour of the UK and a four week on safari across southern Africa. To say we had a lot of luggage is an understatement! Upon arrival the gentleman on reception took one look at all our bags and declared that he was giving us a room upgrade. We were shown to a delightful room in the basement that was more like a suite, with a separate luggage room/walk-in wardrobe and an enormous bathroom. The hotel is in an excellent location, a short walk from Piazza del Popolo and not far from the Vatican. It's also close to a metro station, though we didn't feel the need to use that - we just walked everywhere, which was a treat. A buffet breakfast is served each day and this was more than adequate and kept us going until lunch. The staffe were friendly and efficient and I wouldn't hesitate to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, very poor room”
Reviews.Author: gda27
Reviews.Content: The hotel location in wonderful: very nice neighbourhood and close to the metro station. Common areas in the hotel are in beautiful old style, save for the wide modern room where they serve a good quality buffet for breakfast. We didn’t have special needs, but the staff seemed to be friendly and kind. Our poor rating is referred to the position and general conditions of the room we were given that was not in the main building but in a dependance on the back. To get to the dependance you had to get out through an “emergency” door located in the middle of the lounge bar area, walk through a nice back garden and then open an extra locked gate. The dependance state was very poor compared to the hotel main building (an electric panel was open and cables were coming out of it). The room was on the second floor, with no lift and only narrow stairs. The room itself was quite wide, but absolutely not adequate for a 4 stars hotel (tape on the main lamp, the moquette was in some places detached, the wallpaper had some ripped and stained spots, the heating flow was really noisy, the minibar was broken and the TV had less than 10 channels available… and moreover the bed was so short I had to sleep across it). The bathroom (nice that it had its own window) was absolutely the worst part: freezing, the only heating spot was not working at all, some of the ceiling panels were misplaced, the basin and tub taps were very old, some floor tiles were broken. Obviously, both the room and the bathroom badly needed a deep restyling. The room quality was well below both the 4 stars standard and the overall hotel quality. The impression was that, given our on line reservation, Italian nationality and short stay (we were there for a work week-end), we were given a “spare room” even if we were charged the full rate. A really disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “this is an amazing experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: paulyman
Reviews.Content: Rome is a beautiful city full of antiquities and modern sites to visit. Personally I believe it comes complete with a nice place to stay, and that must be Giulio Cesare. It is very conveniently located with an amazing style. It was recommended by our Italian friends and we sure were glad to get this tip. The staff is very friendly, although italians dont generaly speak other languages thet are very happy to try with gestures and few words they might know. Be advised that Rome (mediterranean cites in general) are quite hot in August!!! But the hotel is well equipped to cope with such issues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Did not get what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: SingingVagabond
Reviews.Content: Our stay was satisfactory. The hotel itself looks well, the main areas and rooms are elegant, comfortable and clean, Its probably just about worth its 4 star rating. Our main problem with the hotel was that we(wife and I) were on this trip with my parents and it was a present for their wedding anniversary, I made a few requests in advance of the trip, we informed them of the fact it was their anniversary and we would like them to have a nice room. We also hoped they might make a point of highlighting the fact that it was their anniversary. I also emailed about 4 days before we arrived to remind them. We got there and the concierge(tall guy with glasses) on the desk was barely welcoming, now i know that request can only me met if possible so i wasn't too bothered, it just would have been a nice touch. All that aside what was most annoying was when we got to our rooms and they had put my parents in a room with two separated single beds, our booking was for 2 rooms with double beds. I was furious. I went to the desk and asked for a different room, he was most unhelpful and said that they were full but that he would change us in the morning. I went back up and swapped with my parents so they would have the room with the double bed. I went down in the morning to change the room and was met with the same useless concierge, I asked about the room he promised the night before, he simply said there are no other rooms and offered no apology, alternative or concession. For me there is no excuse for this and this is why i would not go back. The rest of the staff were very friendly and helpful. Also it advertises safes and tea and coffee , payTV in the rooms, there were none. Again this is unacceptable, but i would have gotten over this if we had got the rooms we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel near the Vatican that makes you feel at home.”
Reviews.Author: Paul33913
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location about a 10 minute walk to the Vatican and 2 blocks off the metro station in a residential neighborhood. We had a room overlooking the garden and slept with the windows open with virtually no street noise. The hotel was very clean we found the king size bed very comfortable. The bathroom was larger in size than many hotels we stayed in with plenty of light and hot water. The breakfasts were great but get there early for the best selection. The staff was courteous and helpful but the owner of the hotel, Vincenzo Pandolfi, elevated our very good experience to great. He is a gracious host who made us feel as if we were part of his family. Vincenzo spent time with us on two of our evenings by the beautiful antique fireplace roasting chestnuts and filling the evening with delightful stories of Rome and his life/family. We will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Room and Service”
Reviews.Author: CarinaJean
Reviews.Content: Located in Testeverde, just north of Vatican City and near the river, it is ideally located. Quiet residential neighborhood a few blocks from the subway. Very nice public spaces and very engaging and welcoming staff. My room was on 5th floor (top floor) so it was very quiet. AC is turned off since Sept 15 in Rome, so it was a bit stuffy at first. The room was spacious, well appointed with fridge, safe, flat screen TV, good lighting. Bathroom was modern and the tub/shower spacious and deep. Beautiful place. Breakfast is more than you normally expect for Italy, even the hot option, which not included eggs, meats, but included many types of vegetables. They don't have restaurant per se, but the bar area serves small plates of hot and cold food. And the bar opens up into a beautiful, tranquil garden. Very nice, indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Bitten and Robbed here.”
Reviews.Author: DrSarahK
Reviews.Content: My friend's handbag was stolen from a table in the dining room during breakfast on a Sunday morning whilst several staff stood around "serving"- there is NO security here. Got home (my friend stuck in Rome awaiting replacement passport) to discover bites all over me... never had bedbugs from a hotel before and have stayed in some pretty budget places. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeterAlmere
Reviews.Content: This hotel proved to be exactly what we wanted: Excellent staff, a wonderful spacy (superior) room with stylish furniture. A great garden where you can relax when you come back from sightseeing and shopping. The hotel does not serve dinner, but with all the great restaurants in Rome, who wants to have dinner at a hotel? They have some snacks, which they serve from 10:00 a.m. thru midnight. And what a breakfast! A wide selection of pastery, cheese, eggs, and fresh fruit, vegetables, salmon etc. etc.. Pastery is made by the chef who does this for probably as long as the hotel is there. And if you want espresso or capucino at breakfast instead of the regular 'American' coffee, you have to ask only once. The rest of your stay you get precisely what you want (two espressi, not 3!), staff knows who you are and remembers what you want, you get it without asking) Very friendly staff. They can arrange for a private car service to the airport for 50 euro (fixed price). If you are more than one person, this is the best way to get there, and just as expensive as a taxi to the railway station and the train, if not cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of warmth and care”
Reviews.Author: angedick007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this fantastic hotel , which is centrally located , for 8 nights. A 10 min walk to the vatican and within reach by foot to most places. Taxis were cheap. We ordered our tour of the vatican through the hotel. The staff were pleasant, efficient and most helpful. We arrived on 31 August and the staff at the reception saw me struggle to get through the door with my suitcase while my husband was ahead of me. He immediately came down and lifted my suitcase right up to the reception. I am very fussy when it comes to cleanliness. But on seeing the rooms and bathroom it immediately relaxed me. The rooms were squeaky clean. Crispy white bedlinen daily and it felt good & .comfortable. Had nothing to fear regarding hygiene . The chambermaids were just as friendly and helpful. An attractive courtyard where you could relax with a newspaper and order a drink from the bar. This is a cool and a relaxing place to be seated after a day of signtseeing. Breakfast was was an excellent spread and delicious. The owner and General Manager Mr. Vincenzo Pandolfi is a warm, caring and a delightful person. The day of our departure he had us sit down with him to a glass of wine and and a couple of delicate pastries. We will always remember him and his wonderful staff. We don't remember their names except for the young lady Christine who is very conscientious & a pleasure to talk to . Mr. Vincenzo and his staff certainly added to our wonderful experience in Rome. Certainly we would love to return & stay in this hotel again. As a result we highly recommend this hotel . Helen and Øystein Javenes Fullriggervein 36, Kristiansand Norway.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: VitaliyS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Giulio Cesare hotel at the end of July 2010 for 2 nights. I booked directly via hotel site at very low rate (for the centrally located Rome hotel) of 99 euros per night including breakfast. Our stay was dedicated to the celebration of my birthday which was on the second day of our stay. I wrote the letter to the hotel few days prior to arrival explaining this fact. They answered me very quickly and informed that they will be happy to provide us with on of the most beautiful Classic rooms they have, free early check in (which I asked for) and in addition with 2 free cocktails in the hotel bar – which they really did on arrival. Check in (as well as check out) procedure was very fast and efficient. Regarding hotel location – it’s almost perfect – hotel is situated on the Vatican bank of the Rome only 2 minutes by foot from Lepanto metro station (direct line to Termini) and only one stop or 10-15 minutes by foot to Vatican. On the other hand it’s only 50-100 meters from Tiber river and within easy walking access to Piazza del Popolo (5 minutes) and Spanish steps (10-15 minutes), in the meantime the latter one is only 2 metro stops away – so you have plenty of choice and in case of necessity can easily reach the hotel if you want to have the break in the middle of the hard day. The room itself was generously sized, with high ceilings, beautiful décor and all amenities you would expect from good 4 star hotel. The interiors of the hotel are beautiful with a lot of atmosphere and the inner courtyard with garden and small waterfall is really a find for escape from hot Rome weather. The breakfast is very good, especially by Italian standards with wide variety of fresh food to choose from, they even have their own honey on offer which they receiving form the family of the owner! By the way the owner is a very pleasant man which greeted us on arrival and said that we can fell like at home and that hotel staff will do their best in this way and they really did. On the day of my birthday after our return from long tour to Vatican Gardens and Museums we found the bottle of Champagne and appetizers in our room – gift from the hotel for my birthday – it was very nice. The cocktails which we ordered on the last night were very good and were served with smile even despite the fact that we asked for it exactly at midnight when the time when bar is closing! Summarizing I would definitely recommend this wonderful hotel for its perfect location, very friendly and efficient staff and very good overall quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Prego26
Reviews.Content: I went with a friend for a four day break to Rome, and we had an amazing time. We didn't arrive till around 11pm so we decided beforehand to pay the extra euros (hotel taxi costs 60 euros) so we had the comfort of knowing someone would be waiting for us when we arrive, as we are both 20 year old girls, who know little Italian and didnt wish to risk trying to make it from the airport alone! The taximan was waiting at the airport with his air conditioned Mercedes and we got to the hotel in just over half an hour. The receptionist was very welcoming, providing us with maps etc, and we settled into our room, next morning we had breakfast which is very good, lots and lots to choose from, cereals, cooked breakfast, cakes, fruit etc If you do go into the bar, make sure you meet the barman Emmanuel, he makes very good cocktails! The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the Piazza Del Popolo, although the streets around the hotel are very dimly lit, so we decided to not stay out too late, as I previously mentioned we are young girls and so came back around half ten/11 most evenings, but the hotel bar is open till around midnight so we went there after dinner for drinks. The hotel is in a good location for the sites, we walked to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the Vatican with no trouble, although on the day we went to the Colosseum we did get the subway to the termini (only 1 euro) and then we walked from there. In terms of seeing the sites, I would definitely recommend prebooking tickets online for the colosseum and the Vatican, as otherwise you will have to queue! Also the rules about the Vatican dress code are very much enforced, we saw many people being turned away, as long as your skirt is below the knee and you have at least a pashmina to cover your shoulders and chest you should be fine. All in all we had a very enjoyable stay, nothing we asked was any trouble (for example we forgot toothpaste and within minutes some was brought up to our room). The room wasnt massive but plenty big enough as a base for our holiday. We had no complaints at all about the hotel. Rome is amazing, you should definitely go! One word of warning though, if you do use the subway, they have ticket machines which you can select English and are therefore very easy to use, but watch out for tramps who stand by the machines and try and help you as they will try and force money out of you, but as long as you are firm and tell them no thank you before they start to help, you should have no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: MiamiViajantes
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, located in a residential area away from the noise of the city yet close. Within walking distance to a metro sudway and if you want to walk a little more you'll find the vatican. The Hotel is very clean and the staff is very friendly and willing to help you. Great value for the money!!

Reviews.Title: “A real victory in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ahakemul
Reviews.Content: Beatifully restored and spacious hotel. Helpfull and correct staff that speaks good English. A bit outside the center but that makes it relaxed in the evening and there is plenty to see in short walking distance. The breakfast was extremely good and assorted. We recommend this hotel without doubt

Reviews.Title: “Clean, efficient, comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: crazyforny
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel more than adequate on all counts. It was a very good experience. The breakfast was excellent as far as food and service. Food was replenished and the maitre d was always ready to fetch a cappucino or expresso for us. The rooms are a bit small and tight but we came to see the sights so we hardly spent time in our rooms. It is a bit of a walk to the the center of Rome so be prepared to put on your walking shoes. The hotel is located in a lovely residential area and the metro is just around the corner which was very convenient. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic...”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgentQLD
Reviews.Content: Thank you Roberto and Roberto & JP (front office) also Pamela... not forgetting the beautiful owner who always welcomes us 'home'....nothing is ever any problem when you understand Italians they are so helpful and caring. Hotel close to Vatican only 18min walk for early morning Mass 7am at St Peter's Basilica. .. dont forget to ask at the Basilica entrance for English / German / Italian etc..... The best shopping in the local neighbourhood. We walked form Hotel Giulio Cesare to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps... so lovely in the evening. ... recommendation YES do stay at Hotel Giulio Cesare

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: zeirdo
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is an overall good hotel. The location is perfect for both vatican and the old parts of rome. The breakfast was ok, nothing special. For a four star hotel, a bit more was expected. A very nice touch is the bar area with the outside patio seating. After a long day; it was heaven to relax in one of the chairs with a cocktail. Two remarks i must make: don't be fooled by the room pictures, they turn out smaller then expected. Also, do not use their airport service. This is just a taxi, which should cost 40 euros (flat fee for airport), they price it at 50 and the taxi driver scams you to pay 60 or more. We ended up paying 50 after having a fight with the driver...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: betdonoh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely. Rooms were sparkling clean, from the floors to the bed linens (and I am super picky!) There is a beautiful courtyard out back that is filled with flowers. We sat under tables with umbrellas and enjoyed wine on our first night there. The included breakfast was a huge buffet, which included bacon and eggs. along with fresh fruits, chesses and meat and breads. The location is also ideal: The neighborhood is more residential than commercial. It is close to the Piazza del Popolo, just over the river, on the Vatican side. We walked to the Spanish Steps and beyond. It is also in walking distance to the Vatican, and local shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms, fantastic staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: mziggy16
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved the hotel. The rooms were comfortable and clean while also giving us a nice view of the area. The complimentary breakfast was great and the hotel staff spoke nearly flawless English and were very friendly and accommdating in doing everything from booking side trips to helping my wife read the instructions on a medicine bottle. The location was good enough for us to walk everywhere, but it was a bit of a hike to Ancient Rome, although the Vatican was only about a mile away and we were close to great shopping and restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Vincenzo, mi sono affezionato a te.....”
Reviews.Author: mrsexylegs
Reviews.Content: Saluti Mrs. Pandolfi, saluti Vincenzo, Brigitte and I would like to THANK YOU so much for your hospitality and generousity during our stay at your hotel from May 17th - 20th. You and your staff made our vacation a pleasant one and we promise to come back very soon!!!! Your hotel has become more home to us than a place to sleep. Again THANK YOU for all you did to make us feel at home. Grazie per lei e un buon giornata di Amburgo. FRANK and BRIGITTE from Hamburg fj.thiel@organomed.org

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel,great breakfast,good location”
Reviews.Author: Droid
Reviews.Content: Travelled in a group of 12 adults - 4 of whom had stayed at the hotel before. Once you get your bearings it is in a good and quiet location. All our bedrooms were in the "East wing" at the back of the main building and were clean (one or two "drain" smells in the bathrooms) and quiet. Breakfast was surprisingly very good - selection of cereal,hot bacon and eggs etc and pastries- one small irritant was tea and coffee serve yourself from a pot which went cold quickly in your cup. Pleasant lounge and outdoor patio for pre-dinner and apres-dinner drinks served by Derek- not sure why he was unable to serve drinks after midnight on the Saturday which was a shame as it was the birthday to celebrate for one of our group and this was a disappointment Overall would return to this hotel and great value for Rome

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: drey232
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! It was clean with average to large rooms for Europe, staff was great, and the free Breakfast was amazing! The staff was also very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty little hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: SlaveToShopping
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by friends and the reviews here are good so we had high hopes. We were very pleasantly surprised that the hotel lived up to the build-up. The photos on their official website do the place justice. We had an 'economy' room for 90 euros (#109). We expected it to be small but was a nice size, full wardrobe, well decorated and clean with a full bathroom/tub. Quiet spot and great location - 5 minutes walk over the bridge to Piazza Popoplo and very close to Vatican. Easy to get to from Central Station. Staff were friendly and recommended a restaurant for us as we arrived rather late on a Friday - if you want pizza past 11pm go to Ristorante Laurus. There's also a great cafe and bakery on the river nearby - Gran Caffe Esperia. Great weekend trip thanks to this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Guilio Cesare, a Roma gem”
Reviews.Author: k9poppy
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time to return to Giulio Cesare, and it was perfect as usual. The staff is great, very helpful and friendly. Everything about this hotel was pleasant. Good rooms, nice outdoor terrace,(great for a glass of wine after a long day of sightseeing). The hotel offers a wonderful breakfast buffett. The Hotel Giulio Cesare is located in a very nice section of Roma, with most sights within walking distance.Hotel Julio Cesare goes out of their way to provide guests with a very enjoyable stay, we will be returning many times. Thanks to everyone at Hotel Giulio Cesare!!!!

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: marco.to
Reviews.Content: We arrived very very late (3:00 am) we ask for a room and they was very gentle helping us. the room was medium small size on the 5 floor - last one. Clean and with nice furniture. Parking is a little small - so if u have a big car can be hard to move it - but was included in our room rate. Wonderful breakfast!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly lovely neighborhood hotel”
Reviews.Author: berrryl
Reviews.Content: Had one day in Rome before a conference and asked for a recommendation from local colleagues. This hotel was fabulous. Low-key, very professional service. Quiet neighborhood very close to The Vatican. Gracious and copious breakfast. Very comfortable, large, well-appointed room. It was a perfect pick for a business traveler with only one day to be a tourist. It was perfect for frequent travelers who prefer a "real" neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vlhnyc
Reviews.Content: Top notch service is what we received during our stay at Hotel Giulio Cesare. As our stay was focused on relaxing and visiting the St. Peter's this was a perfect location. It is a bit of a walk to historic center but not terrible. I'm struck by how the shopping in the neighborhood has changed (for the better) in the last 8 years - it's an interesting section of the city. The rooms at the hotel are extremely clean and the food is quite good. The breakfast service is top notch. There is a lovely garden out back. Staff was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Friendly Staff, perfect retreat after touring sites!”
Reviews.Author: CCScillia
Reviews.Content: After searching through so many options in Rome, we are so glad that we chose this wonderful hotel in the Prati district! Hello to everyone there, especially Manuel and Giovanni! Couldn't have asked for a more delightful stay in Rome and a peaceful place to come to at the end of our site seeing. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. Breakfast was delicious and having the Metro stop two blocks away was perfect. Perfect for folks who do not want to "stay" in the hustle bustle of the tourist district, as the area is residential and quiet at night, though "the" best restaurant in Rome is not far away - Perilli in Prati. Thanks again to Hotel Giulio Cesare for such a wonderful start to our Italian honeymoon, we are recommending to all of our friends and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: Jenny097
Reviews.Content: For the most part, we were very happy with our stay at this hotel. We were upgraded from the older part of the hotel to the newer to start. The staff was very knowledgeable. Breakfast was awesome. The downsides were that you have to pay for internet, the A/C didn't work, and the location, while on a very quiet road, was a least a 5-10 minute walk to the nearest Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a peaceful yet convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Naniwa
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Giulio Cesare is a great hotel, especially if you like to stay in a neighbourhood which is peaceful rather than in amongst all the commotion a capital city has to offer. That said, it was not too far from anything - five minutes to the nearest tube station (Lepanto), and from there it was one stop to the Vatican, and only a few stops to the historic centre of Rome. If the tube is not your thing, it's a couple of minutes to the river and a thirty minute walk down quaint streets to the centre. Being away from the throng of tourists has another advantage - as well as being quiet, the eateries which were close to the hotel were more "Italian" - the ones we went to had a very local feel and were better quality and more reasonably priced than the central ones geared towards fleecing tourists. The hotel itself was very elegant inside. Thankfully air-conditioned, our room was small but adequate and well appointed and decorated. Classical in style but with a modern bathroom and amenities. The staff were all very friendly and spoke English, and the breakfast was good quality with plenty of choice and variety. If we return to Rome again I wouldn't hesitate in booking the hotel. The price is reasonable and we would rather stay there, a short way from the bustle, than smack bang in the middle of the city centre. One 'tip', and it's not a reflection on the hotel - when returning at night, walk along the main road from the tube station until you have to turn down to the hotel. The roads were a grid system so there are a number of chances to turn onto the road that the hotel is on. However, there didn't seem to be any street lights, and apart from some light from the houses that lined the street, it was very dark and the roads and pavements in Rome aren't always too even. The road from the tube is well lit, so you can avoid any pot holes.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: arte-holland
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. Helpful and very friendly staff, good location in a quiet part not far from centre, metro nearby, very nice decorated rooms, excellent breakfast. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Pdelis50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in July while on business in which it was in a perfect location. Hotel in a good location and with a 15 to 20 minute walk to the tourust sites (Vatican, Piazza del Popolo, Spanish Steps)etc. For 110 Euro a night I got a spacious modern confortable quiet room Excellent breakfast spread (if that matters) and also was able to easily get transport to/and from the airport as well as a taxi to the train station . The metro is also near by. For this trip. It was a perfect place to stay

Reviews.Title: “A Very pleasant staying!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dion23
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, friendly environment, nice location with good transportation and easy access to the centre. The room was confortable, spacy, very clean, with good taste.

Reviews.Title: “my choice when I'll be back in Rome”
Reviews.Author: covaltio
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms,a variety of toiletries, a relaxing garden, in a quite neighborhood, friendly staff that recommend to us one of the best trattorias in Italy with superb food and very affordable. The Metro is just minutes away and then in 1 stop we were at the Vatican or in 2-3 stops on the other way to Piazza di Spagna and Via Veneto. We were a group of 6 friends who had a great time and the hotel helped make our 3 day break unforgettable. We´ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: ELENI3
Reviews.Content: Rich breakfast, comfortable and clean rooms, quiet area, green district, though far away from important sightseeings. We used taxi all the time which was overpriced. We stayed in two rooms with our three children in two rooms and we never felt unsecured.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hsaid
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel and it was great experience. It is close to everything. It is quite and they were very helpful. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone. I will be definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Good Location, Good Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SwanseaTraveller01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend when Wales played Italy earlier this month. The hotel accomodated a large mixed group of 15 of us and everyone would go back again due to the service we recieved and the overall experience of the hotel. The breakfast spread catered for everyone and the piano bar provided a relaxing atmosphere to chill out in. The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from the Piaza del Popolo so was ideal. If i was to comment on anything negative it would be that there was some noise in the room, I was directly above the breakfast room which is the reason for this and don't think anyone else in the group had the same issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a decent price”
Reviews.Author: Mills19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days while on our honeymoon. The staff was very friendly and helpful even before we arrived. The hotel was very clean and nice. Room was a good size, we were going to be out mostly anyway. The only complaint I had was that the bed was firmer than I'm used to, but after a night or two I got used to it. There was a complimentary breakfast each morning that was good, had the basics. The location I tought was great. Only 2 blocks from the metro, a 10 minute walk to the Vatician, Olympic Statium about 20 min walk, Spanish Steps about 20 minutes and the Trevi Fountian isn't far from the Spanish Steps. We enjoyed being about to walk to most of the popular monuments, but if we were tired the metro wasn't far. I never felt unsafe walking around at anytime of the night either.

Reviews.Title: “Faded Glory”
Reviews.Author: verbe
Reviews.Content: Impersonal,tatty.Room not serviced until after 3pm.Food and Drink very expensive but very ordinary.Watch out for staff recomendations,not very good.Check you are offered a Licenced taxi on fixed price.Staff tried to use unknown car who quoted overprice to airport. Rome must have better than this

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: harrycatSouthWest
Reviews.Content: The hotel was average, the size of the double bedroom we stayed in was fit for hobbits so if you intend to stay here my advice is book a twin room- two people can stand in these rooms as the same time! Reception staff were average. We stayed in October and for us it was very warm in our broom cupboard (bedroom) but the Hotel switch off the a/c in the winter so it was exceedingly uncomfortably hot during the night and they were unable to offer an alternative like elctric fans. The breakfast was excellent and the waiting staff were extremely helpful. Bar was very expensive G & T £8.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrscress
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on the last part of our honeymoon. We arrived and were not well greeted. When we got to our room it was discovered that it was not cleaned yet and it was about 3pm. We went down in the garden bar for an hour and had drinks and waited. After an hour, we went back up to the room, and found it was still not cleaned. We waited another half hour for the room to be ready. We stayed in a standard room which i would not recommend getting. It was very very tiny with no view at all except trash down below. We were told it could not be switched. After staying in two great hotel rooms previously on our honeymoon we were a little let down. The hotel garden bar is very nice, but very expensive. We stayed in Capri and Sorrento previously and the drinks at their hotels were much cheaper. I paid 5 euros for a tiny glass of Coke that wouldnt even amount to a can of soda. It was 7 euros for a tiny glass of limonchello. 15 euros for brunch. The hotel staff was not as friendly as they were in the previous hotel rooms we stayed in. One night we tried to get a wine bottle opened for us at night so we could have a drink in our room, and we're told that they could not open it for us because their bar was closed, and it was not even 11 at night. We had lunch one day there and it literally took 45 minutes for the waiter to finally bring us a menu after asking several times. It took another half hour to get our food. There is a difference between laid back, and just plain bad service. Besides the hotel we loved Rome, we just would not come back to this hotel again! It was out of the way from all the main sites, and the metro closes at 11:30 so you would have to walk all the way back or take a cab. We will be back to Rome, just not to the hotel. Maybe we got it on a bad week, or they thought we looked young... who knows?

Reviews.Title: “Beware of scammers by hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sirdotalot
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, friendly staff, great breakfasts for the English especially. The down side is the location, walking out of the hotel at night feels like you are walking into some dodgy abandoned area. Rome is very safe but the walk home at night from the centre was very unerving. To cap it all we were approached by scammers 3 x on the metro bridge by the hotel. DO NOT CROSS THIS BRIDGE ALONE! A well dressed man slowed down in his car asking for directions, then offered us free clothing samples because we were English then tried to pull me into the car as he shook my hand, obviously after watch-wallet etc. Then he tried to ask for petrol money, I sent him packing, the wife was taken in by his super friendly approach and would have been well had-off if I hadn't been there. A few days later we crossed the bridge and a Moroccan in a car slowed down to ask for directions to the 'Vatican'. 'Go [--] yourself sent him packing and 5 seconds later the first guy reappears with a different car asking for directions to the Vatican again! My threat of serious violence had him accelerating away. Overall Rome is very-very safe, but I'll have to say the only time I felt threatened was returning to the hotel on foot. Everywhere is closed and boarded up and you walk totally alone with occasional cars passing by. After the above experience this made me very wary indeed.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Italygirl72
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at this hotel. It was elegant, refined and the rooms were spacious and extremely comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful, and friendly and the breakfast was awesome. I loved the location. It was in a residential part of the city, so it was quiet, yet convenient. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: macinra
Reviews.Content: I'd read about renovations to the hotel and was concerned at the possible impact of these on our stay. I need not have worried, there was no work taking place on our visit and in fact all looked to be completed. Firstly, the reception staff were very friendly on our arrival. The booking in was carried out in just 5 Minutes. We were shown to our rooms on the 4th Floor, both were immaculately decorated and in very good condition (noticeably clean). My 20yr old son even commmented on this..... A few reviewers had mentioned that the rooms were small, this was not so with ours, both were large & airy with high ceilings and fancy chandeliers. As already commented by others, the Metro (Lepanto) is very close to the hotel. Easy walking distance to the Castel San Angelo and the Vatican (Leisurely 15 Minutes or so). The Bathroom must also be commented on.... Large, spacious & very clean. Linen and towels are changed daily and the FREE mini bar is also re-stocked daily. One negative I have to mention are the prices charged in the Bar and attractive garden area...These are expensive and I mean expensive!!! All in all a very impressive hotel, one I can wholeheartedly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mgreen418
Reviews.Content: We selected our hotel as a result of Tripadvisor reviews, and were not disappointed. This hotel is located in a beautiful residential neighborhood, close to everything, and far enough away from the city for some quiet. We asked for a renovated room, which we got, and it was quite lovely. Small, by American standards, but larger than the other hotels we stayed in in Italy. The bathroom was clean, large, bright and new, with lots of the amenities you find in American hotels. The air conditioning, (a major concern in Italy in July) worked perfectly. Large plasma TV with very few English channels. WARNING TO THOSE WITH KIDS.... there were several hard core porn channels on the TV in the room with no extra charges. You might want to consult them in advance as to whether or not that can be turned off. All in all, a very nice little hotel (40 some odd rooms) that is very reasonably priced. We paid between 129 - 139 Euro depending on the night, or roughly $180 - $200.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: MikeTW
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous of this, as it was my first visit to Rome, but the tenth Italian hotel I have stayed in in the last 12 months. I thought the capital's hotels would be worse than the hotels in lesser cities, but I couldn't have been more wrong. From check-in to check-out (and after when they looked after our bags) there wasn't a bum note. The location is actually quite good, on the Metro line that serves both the main rail station (Termini, which has a good airport service) and the Vatican and Saint Peter's (or Saint Peeder's, in Iddaly, as most of the voices I heard there pronounced it). I threw a coin in the Trevi fountain, so I will return to Rome, and when I do I'll return to this hotel. Ottimo!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie13
Reviews.Content: My two brothers and I stayed at the Giulio Cesare for a week in April 2008 and found it to be very nice. The hotel is well run and the rooms are clean although a bit small. They have a wonderful breakfast every morning with eggs, sausage and pastries. Our rooms were in the villa which is behind the main hotel. The rooms looked out on a lovely garden space. My only complaint was the lack of air conditioning. Even though we were there in April, it was warm and the hotel doesn't turn the air conditioning on until later in the year. This made the nights somewhat uncomfortable even though the windows could be opened - there was not enough breeze to keep the room cool. The hotel staff was very accomodating. They called cabs for us whenever we requested it and they were very helpful with directions. I would suggest that you NOT take their suggestions for restaruants - we actually went to one of their suggested restaurants and were very disappointed. Please look at having dinner at Alfredos or Le Cupole instead. The hotel location is very good - a short walk from the Tiber river or the Metro Station but getting around Rome is not a problem, cabs are inexpensive and easily available and many places are within walking distance. All in all, our experience with this hotel was good and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice quiet location”
Reviews.Author: gramaj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. It is an older hotel, but very clean and they are doing some renovations. Our room overlooked a little garden patio where you could sit and have a drink. The breakfast is very good and a great selection! It is in a quiet residential area, but only about 15 minutes to the Vatican. There are lots of restaurants close by. It's a good walk across the river to the Coliseum and Trevee fountain, but it's doable. It is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I Love Rome!”
Reviews.Author: HerefordBritAbroad
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night break at Hotel Giulio Cesare and highly recommend it. I had booked the trip to Rome as a 60th birthday surprise for my mum so I was anxious that the hotel and room would be clean and comfortable to 'round' off the whole trip experience. I needn't have worried. Our twin room (417) was very nicely furnished and both it and the bathroom were spotlessly clean. The beds were a little hard but we slept well and you will be so tired out by the walking that it shouldn't bother you! The staff were friendly and discreet and very helpful when asked. The breakfast was plentiful with a wide variety of choice. Hotel Giulio Cesare is based on the Vatican side of the river Tiber and is very well situated for a weekend break, being about a 15 minute stroll to the Vatican and about 20 minutes to the Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain. Although Rome has standardised the taxi fares, this doesn't apply to 'over the river' so instead of the 30 euros we expected to pay, we had to pay 50. If I went again, I think I might try one of the buses that leave every half hour from the airport for about 8 euros and walk across the city or get the metro which stops one street back from the Hotel. Some tips for those going to Rome for the first time: Try to learn a little of the language - don't be self conscious! It will definitely help as, though English is widely spoken, some have just a few phrases and if you know some italian phrases you should be able to muddle through! Buy a Roma Pass - we didn't as we didn't arrive until the Saturday evening and hadn't realised we could until Sunday afternoon. As we had already booked the Vatican for the next day it wasn't worth it...but you can get on and off buses as you like and also get free entrance to the first two museums of your choice (not including Vatican). You will save some money and sore feet in this way! Vatican - If you can, take a packed lunch or something to snack on. You can easily spend a whole day there and there is only one coffee shop (to my knowledge), which only sells water, coffee and icecream and this is half way up the Dome! We booked the official Vatican tour (29 euros), which included a 2 hour tour. Good bits, it was nice to get some of the background on the Sistine Chapel before going in, Bad bits, my mum's headphones packed in within ten minutes of the tour so she had to share my earphones - very hard to stay together in the crowds! Also, you have to go at their pace and can't stop to look at thing which interest you as you want and we felt rushed. If I went again, I would use their audio guide and get the best of both worlds. If you can go up the dome then do, it's hard work but the views are fantastic. By the way, don't buy your water from the vendors outside the square (8 euros for 2 bottles of water and 2 Twix bars! - I know I need to let this go but I couldn't believe it!) Rome is an absolutely wonderful place to visit, with gorgeous things to see wherever you look and very friendly people - my favourite places were the Sistine Chapel, the Colosseum and the Pantheon; my mum's was St Peter's. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Al_M
Reviews.Content: Was a little concerned about staying here from looking at the last review, but our stay at this hotel was great. Even though this hotel is not in the centre of Rome, it is only a small walking distance to the nearest Metro station, which we used alot to get around Rome. The hotel is situated in a nice quiet part of the city. The staff at the hotel were all very friendly and helpful and will recommend nearby places to eat. The rooms are of various sizes, and are very clean. The breakfast was excellent, is a buffet style with plenty of choice. I would recommend this hotel and would most certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Giulio Cesare”
Reviews.Author: RegularTraveller24
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 days in Rome, staying at the Hotel Giulio Cesare. Have to say that prior to going here, a couple of reviews on this web site gave me concerns - however.... I have nothing but good things to say for the hotel. Currently being refurbished, our room on the 4th floor was huge. The furnishings within the room were elegant and new. The bathroom was marble and spotlessly clean throughout. Enough wardrobe space and drawers for a more lengthy stay. Although there was no restaurant, the hotel is situated close to all amenities - from the cheap and cheerful to the expensive. The hotel did provide breakfast, and this was fabulous. The Metro line was within walking distance and was available to get to all the tourist sites in Rome. In fact - we got off the plane, onto the express train (11 Euro's per person) which was non stop to the terminal ( 30 mins max) Down onto the Metro (1 Euro each) and was at the hotel, just within the hour!! (Taxi would have cost 50 Euro's at least). If you like walking, a good base to relax, and not too expensive - I would recommend this hotel. (ps - The Champaigne Cocktails come with canapes!)

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: shekamm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last month on our first trip to Rome and was very happy with our selection. After doing much research regarding amenities desired, location and cost, we were not disappointed. Location was a plus - on our first day I thought it was a little away from some of Rome's center sites, but Rome is a walking city and we ended up appreciating being away from some of the touristy areas. If you are only in town for a few days and the Vatican is your main focus, even better. Also very close to Piazza Popolo and Castle St Angelo. Staff was efficent. Serena was our friend in the lounge each evening for a night cap and was very friendly, rest of staff nice but not overly. Got a snack (nuts, chips or canapes) with all our drink orders, which was nice (the lounge drinks were expensive, but hey we were on vacation!). Hotel is very charming and clean. Arrived in the morning from the US and had no problem checking in early. First room was a little tight (by American standards) and was immediately transferred to a larger room upon request with a better view on the 4th floor. Bathrooms are nice and we did have a tub and a bidet. However, if the hotel is full, hot water was a problem around 8-9am, better to shower early or after breakfast. Breakfast was good and enough to fill you up for a day of walking. Also allows for a lighter lunch which saves some $. Feb was not really a bad time to go to Rome, weather was in the high 50s, which was a relief from Midwest winters, and more comfortable walking for hours and hours each day. Paid just over $170/night and was worth the money. Other info, taxi to/from airport was about 50 euros. Computer with internet access available for free in one of the common areas, great for checking emails and to communicate home w/o the phone cost. Very close to Lepanto metro station. Drawbacks - bed was a little hard, but after days of walking slept just fine. Mentioned the hot water. Opened our window each day upon returning to hotel because the room was so warm. But the fresh air was nice. All in all very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend break”
Reviews.Author: snowie25
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend break at this lovely hotel. We took the train from the airport to termini and then got the metro to Lepanto station which is a less than 5 minute walk to the hotel - this saved us loads of money in taxis! Check in was hassle free - although they had run out of double rooms and considered giving us a twin room (not great for a romantic break!) when i said i would not like to have seperate beds they happily gave us a lovely big triple room with a huge kig size bed and a single bed. Very nicely decorated and the bathroom looked brand new. we were both really impressed with the room. The staff at the hotel were very very nice and go out their way to be polite and helpful. We asked thier advice on going for a special meal and at a moments notice the conceirge had us booked into a lovely resturant (Hi Res) and had even drawn directions on a map after we declined a taxi. They were always helpful and polite at the hotel which was really nice. breakfast in the hotel is pretty good - a massive selection and the home made honey is gorgeous! the hotel is perfectly placed just outside the centre but its well served by the metro and although we bought metro passes we were well able to walk everywhere within about 20 - 30mins. it was nice to walk over the bridge and out of the hussle and bussle of town yet still near enough not to be a pain. overall i really enjoyed my break and i will definitely be returning to the eternal city one day - despite the fact food and drink is ridiculously expensive in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spercy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. Our room was quite small but when in Rome you don't spend much time in the hotel anyway. It was spotless and beautifully decorated. The staff at reception were very helpful and there is computer with printer and internet access in the lounge. The breakfast is fantastic and sets you up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: andronicus81
Reviews.Content: This place was close enough to everything, especially the vatican. The staff was very professional and kind. The funny part though, was the mirrors on the ceiling (probably for decor and not for function) and the 2 porn channels that were on 24/7. Great breakfast. The owner keeps beehives (not on location) and provides his own honey as a condiment. Great stay in a lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Larkspur101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in January. Our room was lovely and the hotel is in an ideal location. Easy walk to Piazza del Popolo, Vatican and anywhere else for that matter. The buffet breakfast was very good too. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: kopernikus
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Giulio Cesare in Jan 2008 and enjoyed every minute. The hotel is in an ideal location near the Vatican and the Spanish Steps. The metro station Lepanto is only a 5 minutes walk away. The rooms were immaculate and very nice furnished. The Breakfast Buffet was also very good and offered great food. Instead of quantity the focus was on quality. All the employees were very friendly. Especially Roberto the young concierge. The only drawback was the elder concierge who was a bit snobbish. I can only recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful New Year Location”
Reviews.Author: CandP13
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel to everyone! We stayed for 3 days over the New Year period 2007/2008. All members of staff were charming and extremely helpful - nothing was too much trouble. The hotel was very busy at this time - especially at breakfast but this was not a problem as the staff were very efficient and looked after everyone well. The buffet breakfast was one of the best my husband and I have had, and we have both travelled on business around Europe in plenty of higher rated hotels. Our room (not large) but had plenty of storage, the bed was comfortable and the room temperature was controllable. Bathroom (small) but efficient and very clean. The Vatican is only minutes walk from the hotel, and all the other sites can also be easily reached. The hotel is situated in a quiet location but again very good restaurants can be found within 10 minutes walk. Our only negative comment would be to watch out for taxi drivers overcharging you even with thier meters running! Also some restuarants waiters can be a bit 'touchy' if they are unable to 'charm' you into the most expensive dish and often comment "is that all" if you only order a couple of courses - even if the Italian family next to you are doing the same! Overall a wonderful trip and the hotel exceeded our expectations - very clean, very efficient, very charming and excellent service. We were even left a bottle of sparkling wine in your room with their compliments for New Year! We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest People in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BungaGigHarbor
Reviews.Content: The staff couldn't have been nicer! Simone in the bar took care of us every night (5 night stay), arranged dinner plans even offered to take my wife shoe shopping. The front desk staff took care of any details that we needed help with. The breakfast was the best. I recommend this property to anyone. With such easy access to the metro line only a short walk away, it is a great home base for a Rome vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: georgina9
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for a week. The room was lovely with an excellent. breakfast included. They had a wonderful lounge/bar area. Outside, a lovely garden where we sipped espressos in perfect peace and quiet. The staff was terrific, very helpful with everything. I speak Italian, so language wasn't an issue. The best part of the hotel was the location. Quiet residential area near the Vatican. My favorite area of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: adimino
Reviews.Content: Took a train from Termini to the closest station near the hotel. Hotel staff was very friendly and very helpful. They spoke perfect English. There was free Internet access in the lobby near the bar. Smallish room but clean with a clean bathroom. Able to walk to the Vatican from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mamma Mia!!!”
Reviews.Author: RooMir
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 6 days at the Hotel Giulio Cesare in Rome to celebrate my 40th birthday. We had booked and paid for via British Airways a non-smoking, Superior room. Upon arriving on Sept 27th 2007 we were presented with a very small, dark, room at the back of the hotel. The room reeked of stale tobacco.
