It was so small, that my partner and I could not pass one another in the narrow space between the end of the bed and the wall and had to climb over the bed to reach the bathroom.We immediately queried with Reception why we had not been allocated a Superior room and were not given a satisfactory explanation. We asked to be moved to another room, only to be told the hotel was fully booked. This situation continued for 4 days where we were fobbed off with 3 different room changes, none of which was a Superior room, and finally in frustration, we contacted British Airways who resolved the issue immediately and we were moved to a Superior room. Without their intervention, the hotel would not have resolved the issue and would happily would have continued to accept the monies without providing the agreed product. So, on the 5th day of our stay, we were finally allocated the room we were supposed to have had. We have stayed in numerous hotels around the world, and none have been so unhelpful and evasive as the Hotel Giulio Cesare. Needless to say, we were very disappointed by our stay at this hotel and shall not be returning or recommending it to any of our friends or family. PS. Don't stay anywhere near the 5th floor as it is under renovation and is very noisy at 7.30 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A splendid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimaria
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a week after reading favourable reviews on Trip advisor and were not disappointed. The hotel was beautifully appointed and all the staff were excellent especially Sergio in reception and Simona in the Bar. The location was quiet but within easy walking distance of many historic sites and museums. Expensive but if you can afford it - well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: celeste652
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel... From start to finish it is a real find in a busy loud city. The breakfast was one of the best buffets I have had in Europe. This is the only place I will ever stay in Rome. A safe neighborhood and free parking in a secured lot. Call ahead for the parking. I met the owner in the hall on his way to dinner and he formerly introduced himself. A lovely man and a lovely way to spend my evening before seeing the Pope on Sunday at noon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelteacher1
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked at the Hotel Regency, but they cancelled at the last minute due to hotel renovations, so we were moved to this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised by the room and the hotel. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. They provided us with a map of the city and gave some good suggestions for dinner. The hotel is located in the Prati district of Rome, only about a 15 minute walk down treelined streets from the Vatican. Very lovely neighborhood. The hotel is on the opposite side of the Tiber from the Piazza del Popolo, but it is only about a 10 minute walk from there. The room was clean as was the bathroom. The bathroom there is a tub/shower combo, which is really nice after a long day of walking around the city. The breakfast that was provided far exceeded my expectations. They provide fruit, pastries, eggs, sausage, cold cuts and cheese, a variety of breads, juice, and fresh coffee (no cafeteria style machine, but a real espresso/coffee maker). They make your coffee for you and bring it to your table. Very nice! You would do well to take the metro into the other areas of town. The station is only around the corner and down the street (about 300 meters). Very easy to get to and the hotel staff provided excellent directions. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Dondy-Maclean
Reviews.Content: Beyond our expectations. Took my parents on holiday so wanted a comfortable hotel and not too noisy. It was perfect! Central location, spotlessly clean and good breakfast. Superior rooms for reasonable price (booked hotel through British Airways).

Reviews.Title: “Love the Location and the breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Salsauk
Reviews.Content: My Mum had always wanted go to Rome and having stayed near Termini station before myself didn't want to repeat that experience so booked the Giulio Cesare. The area is peaceful and feels safe is near to shopping and a very short walk to the Vatican and Piazza del Popolo. The hotel was lovely, we stayed in two rooms, initially a slightly faded room just off the pretty garden near the hotel bar then a more recently decorated room (with a safe). In the summer the garden room would probably be preferrable but as it rained, hailed, and sleeted our second room was cosy (on the ground floor, warm, a superior room a little bit bigger than first room). The breakfast had anything you could possibly want from cheeses, ham,s fruit, cereal etc to fried eggs, boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, bacon, several breads, cakes, croissants and honey produced by the owners farm. One very cold evening we ate at the hotel bar which is a bit pricey but the insalata caprese was lovely. Nearby are several restaurants pointed out to us by the concierge who was very helpful. Also not so far away on the Via Guilio Cesare are some cheaper pizzerias or if you fancy walking good restaurants in the Centro Storico. We were always too full up from breakfast to eat lunch but did have nice ice creams or coffee midday. The only complaint I heard was from one English lady (I am English too) who didn't seem to appreciate the breakfast I overheard her saying 'this can't be the best breakfast in Rome'...very embarrassing with so much food around! All in all a lovely hotel in a peaceful area and nice to come back to after a day tramping around Roma! RECOMMENDED...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location yet Peaceful at the JC”
Reviews.Author: Grrralph
Reviews.Content: Four nights in December at this traditional hotel exceeded expectations. In some parts the hotel shows signs of a faded splendour, but it has character, style and charm in abundance and was spotlessly clean throughout. Ours was a ground floor double room that I could not fault. Excellent breakfast including (taste the difference) honey from the proprietor's own farm. They clearly take a pride in the place and aim to excel. The hotel is situated within about 15-20 minutes easy stroll of St Peters / Vatican in one direction and Spanish Steps in the other. The Lepanto Metro station is practically round the corner. Still, the location is just off the beaten tourist track. This is a positive as the location is in one of the city's quieter and classier districts. I recommend this hotel, unless your preference is for accomodation and facilities with a newer and modern atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Pope!”
Reviews.Author: frankstrong
Reviews.Content: We just completed our stay. While they are still working on the hotel, we stayed on the third floor, we had very restful sleeps. The breakfast is very complete, staff helpful. Only two blocks to the underground. Midway between the Vitcan and the Spanish Steps. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Vatican”
Reviews.Author: awle
Reviews.Content: We found this to be a great hotel. It was clean, the staff were friendly and helpful, the breakfast was good, the garden was a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Stevepack
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 days at the Giulio Cesare,Rome which was to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. We could not have picked a nicer hotel, the staff were warm and friendly and all spoke English,and couln`t do enough for you. Our room was excellent,and was cleaned every day, which included fresh bed linen and towels. The location of the hotel is within easy walking distance to St.Peter`s Basilica and to the metro which provides easy access to other sights. The only draw back with the hotel is that is does not have a restaurant but there are many within easy walking distanced.That said, the bar does provide excellent bar snacks. On the plus side the breakfast provide by the hotel is more than ample and is of the highest quality. As you can see we had a wonderful time and intend returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: pdemetree
Reviews.Content: My family and I just spent three nights here. The air-conditioning was awful and the place is being remodeled so the hammering started about 7:00am each morning. At one point, some dust came off the ceiling and landed on my wife as she was getting ready to go out from the hammering in the room above us. I would not go back. The front desk has the ability to lower the air-conditioning but will wait until you complain. Not the best way to run a business.

Reviews.Title: “Recommending Hotel Giulio Cesare”
Reviews.Author: Mishka28
Reviews.Content: Excellent 4-star hotel on Via degli Scipioni in Prati district, no more than15 min walk from Piazza del Popolo and 15 min also from St Peter / the Vatican museums. And it's 2 min only from the "Lepanto" subway station. Nicely decorated rooms with all modern amenities; shaded garden. No restaurant, but serves small dishes. Very good breakfast buffet (especially when comparing with many other, even well-known hotels in Rome). The charme of this hotel is not just its excellent location, in a nice and quiet (for Rome!) area and yet quite central (see above) - it is the friendliness of the staff and the feel of a comfortable place that has nothing to do with the anonimity of bigger hotels. Giulio Cesare has been run by the same family ever since this former "Villa" was converted into a hotel; most of the staff have been working there for years which is always a good sign. We stay there every time we go to Rome and can highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and helpful, rooms were very nice and very clean (bed was a little hard), location was great and the breakfast was lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: Termc9074
Reviews.Content: We just got back 3/23/06 stayed 4 nights.The hotel is good,but the walls are paper thin.Our neighbors got up at 5 am every morning and we could hear everything from the shower to the blow dryer.And they are under construction so we heard banging at 6am 2 mornings. Also the hotel restaurant is closed in the off season,just open for breakfast.We were wanting for a table in the bar for 45 min and they turned away at least 25 people??

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: nalaa
Reviews.Content: very small room. incredibly small bathroom. stayed here during our honeymoon and were very dissapointed by all that. our room was so tine that there were no space at all even to walk around the bed. but there was a tiny balcony with the table - the only place where we didnt feel like trapped. the stuff was unfriendly. i guess i wont stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Can't find fault”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very close to lepanto metro station (5 min walk max), great location - peaceful, but only 15 mins walk from spanish steps if you miss the last metro (and it's a safe, well lit route). The hotel itself is lovely, very clean, very helpful and polite staff, amazing choice at breakfast (with homemade honey!). I can't find fault with this hotel - will definitely stay again when we're next in rome.

Reviews.Title: “A great value and location”
Reviews.Author: West Vancouverite
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been in Rome a few times and we think this hotel offers, by far, the best value, location, service and breakfast. The first two levels are upgraded and level 3 and 4 are a bit dated. Still, overall, you can not go wrong by staying at this hotel. Highly recommended

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Giulio Cesare
HotelInfo.Address: Via Degli Scipioni 287, 00192 Rome, Italy
